data.text: @mysteriouskat Could be, though no spike whatsoever is still impressive. Gives you an idea about how useful are the restrictions.

@Gigusek_dev I suspect it's because most of the masks people wear don't protect them at all, or if they do, it's negligible and possibly even cancelled out by bacteria infections. N95s and other more capable masks are a different story, but a much smaller amount of the population wears them.
@Gigusek_dev I think the reason that demonstrations generally didn't cause spikes is because they are outdoors, although in close proximity. But outdoor transmission is quite rare.

@mysteriouskat I think Czech could be an interesting place to look at. Few days ago they had demonstrations of 80k people in Prague, still with masks but in very close contact. It doesn't seem their cases or hospitalizations have increased.

@mysteriouskat Correct! It's not a perfect case study though - restrictions were removed but we've already had streets full of people, so not much has really changed. The main difference is that there are far fewer masks which could potentially contribute to higher cases (but didn't).
@mysteriouskat @stillgray amazing what happens when they lower the PCR cycles to what they were originally designed to be.
@Gigusek_dev True. The dip isn't because of mandate removal, it's just the general trend. BUT it has also shown that cases didn't go up.
@mysteriouskat It's likely seasonal decrease and unrelated to the removal of the restrictions. If anything, we should have learned from the last two years that covid is seasonal.
